8// objects and related functionality. [OpenGL ES 2.0.24] section 4.4 page 105.

38bool CheckMultiviewStateMatchesForCompleteness(const FramebufferAttachment *firstAttachment,
39 const FramebufferAttachment *secondAttachment)
40{
41 ASSERT(firstAttachment && secondAttachment);
42 ASSERT(firstAttachment->isAttached() && secondAttachment->isAttached());
43
44 if (firstAttachment->getNumViews() != secondAttachment->getNumViews())
45 {
46 return false;
47 }
48 if (firstAttachment->getBaseViewIndex() != secondAttachment->getBaseViewIndex())
49 {
50 return false;
51 }
52 if (firstAttachment->isMultiview() != secondAttachment->isMultiview())
53 {
54 return false;
55 }
56 return true;
57}
58
59bool CheckAttachmentCompleteness(const Context *context, const FramebufferAttachment &attachment)
60{
61 ASSERT(attachment.isAttached());
62
63 const Extents &size = attachment.getSize();
64 if (size.width == 0 || size.height == 0)
65 {
66 return false;
67 }
68
69 if (!attachment.isRenderable(context))
70 {
71 return false;
72 }
73
74 if (attachment.type() == GL_TEXTURE)
75 {
76 // [EXT_geometry_shader] Section 9.4.1, "Framebuffer Completeness"
77 // If <image> is a three-dimensional texture or a two-dimensional array texture and the
78 // attachment is not layered, the selected layer is less than the depth or layer count,
79 // respectively, of the texture.
80 if (!attachment.isLayered())
81 {
82 if (attachment.layer() >= size.depth)
83 {
84 return false;
85 }
86 }
87 // If <image> is a three-dimensional texture or a two-dimensional array texture and the
88 // attachment is layered, the depth or layer count, respectively, of the texture is less
89 // than or equal to the value of MAX_FRAMEBUFFER_LAYERS_EXT.
90 else
91 {
92 if (size.depth >= context->getCaps().maxFramebufferLayers)
93 {
94 return false;
95 }
96 }
97
98 // ES3 specifies that cube map texture attachments must be cube complete.
99 // This language is missing from the ES2 spec, but we enforce it here because some
100 // desktop OpenGL drivers also enforce this validation.
101 // TODO(jmadill): Check if OpenGL ES2 drivers enforce cube completeness.
102 const Texture *texture = attachment.getTexture();
103 ASSERT(texture);
104 if (texture->getType() == TextureType::CubeMap &&
105 !texture->getTextureState().isCubeComplete())
106 {
107 return false;
108 }
109
110 if (!texture->getImmutableFormat())
111 {
112 GLuint attachmentMipLevel = static_cast<GLuint>(attachment.mipLevel());
113
114 // From the ES 3.0 spec, pg 213:
115 // If the value of FRAMEBUFFER_ATTACHMENT_OBJECT_TYPE is TEXTURE and the value of
116 // FRAMEBUFFER_ATTACHMENT_OBJECT_NAME does not name an immutable-format texture,
117 // then the value of FRAMEBUFFER_ATTACHMENT_TEXTURE_LEVEL must be in the
118 // range[levelbase, q], where levelbase is the value of TEXTURE_BASE_LEVEL and q is
119 // the effective maximum texture level defined in the Mipmapping discussion of
120 // section 3.8.10.4.
121 if (attachmentMipLevel < texture->getBaseLevel() ||
122 attachmentMipLevel > texture->getMipmapMaxLevel())
123 {
124 return false;
125 }
126
127 // Form the ES 3.0 spec, pg 213/214:
128 // If the value of FRAMEBUFFER_ATTACHMENT_OBJECT_TYPE is TEXTURE and the value of
129 // FRAMEBUFFER_ATTACHMENT_OBJECT_NAME does not name an immutable-format texture and
130 // the value of FRAMEBUFFER_ATTACHMENT_TEXTURE_LEVEL is not levelbase, then the
131 // texture must be mipmap complete, and if FRAMEBUFFER_ATTACHMENT_OBJECT_NAME names
132 // a cubemap texture, the texture must also be cube complete.
133 if (attachmentMipLevel != texture->getBaseLevel() && !texture->isMipmapComplete())
134 {
135 return false;
136 }
137 }
138 }
139
140 return true;
141}
142
143bool CheckAttachmentSampleCounts(const Context *context,
144 GLsizei currAttachmentSamples,
145 GLsizei samples,
146 bool colorAttachment)
147{
148 if (currAttachmentSamples != samples)
149 {
150 if (colorAttachment)
151 {
152 // APPLE_framebuffer_multisample, which EXT_draw_buffers refers to, requires that
153 // all color attachments have the same number of samples for the FBO to be complete.
154 return false;
155 }
156 else
157 {
158 // CHROMIUM_framebuffer_mixed_samples allows a framebuffer to be considered complete
159 // when its depth or stencil samples are a multiple of the number of color samples.
160 if (!context->getExtensions().framebufferMixedSamples)
161 {
162 return false;
163 }
164
165 if ((currAttachmentSamples % std::max(samples, 1)) != 0)
166 {
167 return false;
168 }
169 }
170 }
171 return true;
172}
173
174bool CheckAttachmentSampleCompleteness(const Context *context,
175 const FramebufferAttachment &attachment,
176 bool colorAttachment,
177 Optional<int> *samples,
178 Optional<bool> *fixedSampleLocations,
179 Optional<int> *renderToTextureSamples)
180{
181 ASSERT(attachment.isAttached());
182
183 if (attachment.type() == GL_TEXTURE)
184 {
185 const Texture *texture = attachment.getTexture();
186 ASSERT(texture);
187 GLenum internalFormat = attachment.getFormat().info->internalFormat;
188 const TextureCaps &formatCaps = context->getTextureCaps().get(internalFormat);
189 if (static_cast<GLuint>(attachment.getSamples()) > formatCaps.getMaxSamples())
190 {
191 return false;
192 }
193
194 const ImageIndex &attachmentImageIndex = attachment.getTextureImageIndex();
195 bool fixedSampleloc = texture->getAttachmentFixedSampleLocations(attachmentImageIndex);
196 if (fixedSampleLocations->valid() && fixedSampleloc != fixedSampleLocations->value())
197 {
198 return false;
199 }
200 else
201 {
202 *fixedSampleLocations = fixedSampleloc;
203 }
204 }
205
206 if (renderToTextureSamples->valid())
207 {
208 // Only check against RenderToTextureSamples if they actually exist.
209 if (renderToTextureSamples->value() !=
210 FramebufferAttachment::kDefaultRenderToTextureSamples)
211 {
212 if (!CheckAttachmentSampleCounts(context, attachment.getRenderToTextureSamples(),
213 renderToTextureSamples->value(), colorAttachment))
214 {
215 return false;
216 }
217 }
218 }
219 else
220 {
221 *renderToTextureSamples = attachment.getRenderToTextureSamples();
222 }
223
224 if (samples->valid())
225 {
226 // RenderToTextureSamples takes precedence if they exist.
227 if (renderToTextureSamples->value() ==
228 FramebufferAttachment::kDefaultRenderToTextureSamples)
229 {
230 if (!CheckAttachmentSampleCounts(context, attachment.getSamples(), samples->value(),
231 colorAttachment))
232 {
233 return false;
234 }
235 }
236 }
237 else
238 {
239 *samples = attachment.getSamples();
240 }
241
242 return true;
243}
244
245// Needed to index into the attachment arrays/bitsets.
246static_assert(static_cast<size_t>(IMPLEMENTATION_MAX_DRAW_BUFFERS) ==
247 Framebuffer::DIRTY_BIT_COLOR_ATTACHMENT_MAX,
248 "Framebuffer Dirty bit mismatch");
249static_assert(static_cast<size_t>(IMPLEMENTATION_MAX_DRAW_BUFFERS) ==
250 Framebuffer::DIRTY_BIT_DEPTH_ATTACHMENT,
251 "Framebuffer Dirty bit mismatch");
252static_assert(static_cast<size_t>(IMPLEMENTATION_MAX_DRAW_BUFFERS + 1) ==
253 Framebuffer::DIRTY_BIT_STENCIL_ATTACHMENT,
254 "Framebuffer Dirty bit mismatch");
255
256angle::Result InitAttachment(const Context *context, FramebufferAttachment *attachment)
257{
258 ASSERT(attachment->isAttached());
259 if (attachment->initState() == InitState::MayNeedInit)
260 {
261 ANGLE_TRY(attachment->initializeContents(context));
262 }
263 return angle::Result::Continue;
264}
265
266bool AttachmentOverlapsWithTexture(const FramebufferAttachment &attachment,
267 const Texture *texture,
268 const Sampler *sampler)
269{
270 if (!attachment.isTextureWithId(texture->id()))
271 {
272 return false;
273 }
274
275 const gl::ImageIndex &index = attachment.getTextureImageIndex();
276 GLuint attachmentLevel = static_cast<GLuint>(index.getLevelIndex());
277 GLuint textureBaseLevel = texture->getBaseLevel();
278 GLuint textureMaxLevel = textureBaseLevel;
279 if ((sampler && IsMipmapFiltered(sampler->getSamplerState().getMinFilter())) ||
280 IsMipmapFiltered(texture->getSamplerState().getMinFilter()))
281 {
282 textureMaxLevel = texture->getMipmapMaxLevel();
283 }
284
285 return attachmentLevel >= textureBaseLevel && attachmentLevel <= textureMaxLevel;
286}
287} // anonymous namespace
288
289// This constructor is only used for default framebuffers.
290FramebufferState::FramebufferState(rx::Serial serial)
291 : mId(Framebuffer::kDefaultDrawFramebufferHandle),
292 mFramebufferSerial(serial),
293 mLabel(),
294 mColorAttachments(1),
295 mColorAttachmentsMask(0),
296 mDrawBufferStates(1, GL_BACK),
297 mReadBufferState(GL_BACK),
298 mDrawBufferTypeMask(),
299 mDefaultWidth(0),
300 mDefaultHeight(0),
301 mDefaultSamples(0),
302 mDefaultFixedSampleLocations(GL_FALSE),
303 mDefaultLayers(0),
304 mWebGLDepthStencilConsistent(true),
305 mDefaultFramebufferReadAttachmentInitialized(false)
306{
307 ASSERT(mDrawBufferStates.size() > 0);
308 mEnabledDrawBuffers.set(0);
309}
310
311FramebufferState::FramebufferState(const Caps &caps, FramebufferID id, rx::Serial serial)
312 : mId(id),
313 mFramebufferSerial(serial),
314 mLabel(),
315 mColorAttachments(caps.maxColorAttachments),
316 mColorAttachmentsMask(0),
317 mDrawBufferStates(caps.maxDrawBuffers, GL_NONE),
318 mReadBufferState(GL_COLOR_ATTACHMENT0_EXT),
319 mDrawBufferTypeMask(),
320 mDefaultWidth(0),
321 mDefaultHeight(0),
322 mDefaultSamples(0),
323 mDefaultFixedSampleLocations(GL_FALSE),
324 mDefaultLayers(0),
325 mWebGLDepthStencilConsistent(true),
326 mDefaultFramebufferReadAttachmentInitialized(false)
327{
328 ASSERT(mId != Framebuffer::kDefaultDrawFramebufferHandle);
329 ASSERT(mDrawBufferStates.size() > 0);
330 mDrawBufferStates[0] = GL_COLOR_ATTACHMENT0_EXT;
331}
332
333FramebufferState::~FramebufferState() {}
334
335const std::string &FramebufferState::getLabel() const
336{
337 return mLabel;
338}
339
340const FramebufferAttachment *FramebufferState::getAttachment(const Context *context,
341 GLenum attachment) const
342{
343 if (attachment >= GL_COLOR_ATTACHMENT0 && attachment <= GL_COLOR_ATTACHMENT15)
344 {
345 return getColorAttachment(attachment - GL_COLOR_ATTACHMENT0);
346 }
347
348 // WebGL1 allows a developer to query for attachment parameters even when "inconsistant" (i.e.
349 // multiple conflicting attachment points) and requires us to return the framebuffer attachment
350 // associated with WebGL.
351 switch (attachment)
352 {
353 case GL_COLOR:
354 case GL_BACK:
355 return getColorAttachment(0);
356 case GL_DEPTH:
357 case GL_DEPTH_ATTACHMENT:
358 if (context->isWebGL1())
359 {
360 return getWebGLDepthAttachment();
361 }
362 else
363 {
364 return getDepthAttachment();
365 }
366 case GL_STENCIL:
367 case GL_STENCIL_ATTACHMENT:
368 if (context->isWebGL1())
369 {
370 return getWebGLStencilAttachment();
371 }
372 else
373 {
374 return getStencilAttachment();
375 }
376 case GL_DEPTH_STENCIL:
377 case GL_DEPTH_STENCIL_ATTACHMENT:
378 if (context->isWebGL1())
379 {
380 return getWebGLDepthStencilAttachment();
381 }
382 else
383 {
384 return getDepthStencilAttachment();
385 }
386 default:
387 UNREACHABLE();
388 return nullptr;
389 }
390}
391
392uint32_t FramebufferState::getReadIndex() const
393{
394 ASSERT(mReadBufferState == GL_BACK ||
395 (mReadBufferState >= GL_COLOR_ATTACHMENT0 && mReadBufferState <= GL_COLOR_ATTACHMENT15));
396 uint32_t readIndex = mReadBufferState == GL_BACK ? 0 : mReadBufferState - GL_COLOR_ATTACHMENT0;
397 ASSERT(readIndex < mColorAttachments.size());
398 return readIndex;
399}
400
401const FramebufferAttachment *FramebufferState::getReadAttachment() const
402{
403 if (mReadBufferState == GL_NONE)
404 {
405 return nullptr;
406 }
407
408 uint32_t readIndex = getReadIndex();
409 const gl::FramebufferAttachment &framebufferAttachment =
410 isDefault() ? mDefaultFramebufferReadAttachment : mColorAttachments[readIndex];
411
412 return framebufferAttachment.isAttached() ? &framebufferAttachment : nullptr;
413}
414
415const FramebufferAttachment *FramebufferState::getReadPixelsAttachment(GLenum readFormat) const
416{
417 switch (readFormat)
418 {
419 case GL_DEPTH_COMPONENT:
420 return getDepthAttachment();
421 case GL_STENCIL_INDEX_OES:
422 return getStencilOrDepthStencilAttachment();
423 default:
424 return getReadAttachment();
425 }
426}
427
428const FramebufferAttachment *FramebufferState::getFirstNonNullAttachment() const
429{
430 auto *colorAttachment = getFirstColorAttachment();
431 if (colorAttachment)
432 {
433 return colorAttachment;
434 }
435 return getDepthOrStencilAttachment();
436}
437
438const FramebufferAttachment *FramebufferState::getFirstColorAttachment() const
439{
440 for (const FramebufferAttachment &colorAttachment : mColorAttachments)
441 {
442 if (colorAttachment.isAttached())
443 {
444 return &colorAttachment;
445 }
446 }
447
448 return nullptr;
449}
450
451const FramebufferAttachment *FramebufferState::getDepthOrStencilAttachment() const
452{
453 if (mDepthAttachment.isAttached())
454 {
455 return &mDepthAttachment;
456 }
457 if (mStencilAttachment.isAttached())
458 {
459 return &mStencilAttachment;
460 }
461 return nullptr;
462}
463
464const FramebufferAttachment *FramebufferState::getStencilOrDepthStencilAttachment() const
465{
466 if (mStencilAttachment.isAttached())
467 {
468 return &mStencilAttachment;
469 }
470 return getDepthStencilAttachment();
471}
472
473const FramebufferAttachment *FramebufferState::getColorAttachment(size_t colorAttachment) const
474{
475 ASSERT(colorAttachment < mColorAttachments.size());
476 return mColorAttachments[colorAttachment].isAttached() ? &mColorAttachments[colorAttachment]
477 : nullptr;
478}
479
480const FramebufferAttachment *FramebufferState::getDepthAttachment() const
481{
482 return mDepthAttachment.isAttached() ? &mDepthAttachment : nullptr;
483}
484
485const FramebufferAttachment *FramebufferState::getWebGLDepthAttachment() const
486{
487 return mWebGLDepthAttachment.isAttached() ? &mWebGLDepthAttachment : nullptr;
488}
489
490const FramebufferAttachment *FramebufferState::getWebGLDepthStencilAttachment() const
491{
492 return mWebGLDepthStencilAttachment.isAttached() ? &mWebGLDepthStencilAttachment : nullptr;
493}
494
495const FramebufferAttachment *FramebufferState::getStencilAttachment() const
496{
497 return mStencilAttachment.isAttached() ? &mStencilAttachment : nullptr;
498}
499
500const FramebufferAttachment *FramebufferState::getWebGLStencilAttachment() const
501{
502 return mWebGLStencilAttachment.isAttached() ? &mWebGLStencilAttachment : nullptr;
503}
504
505const FramebufferAttachment *FramebufferState::getDepthStencilAttachment() const
506{
507 // A valid depth-stencil attachment has the same resource bound to both the
508 // depth and stencil attachment points.
509 if (mDepthAttachment.isAttached() && mStencilAttachment.isAttached() &&
510 mDepthAttachment == mStencilAttachment)
511 {
512 return &mDepthAttachment;
513 }
514
515 return nullptr;
516}
517
518bool FramebufferState::attachmentsHaveSameDimensions() const
519{
520 Optional<Extents> attachmentSize;
521
522 auto hasMismatchedSize = [&attachmentSize](const FramebufferAttachment &attachment) {
523 if (!attachment.isAttached())
524 {
525 return false;
526 }
527
528 if (!attachmentSize.valid())
529 {
530 attachmentSize = attachment.getSize();
531 return false;
532 }
533
534 const auto &prevSize = attachmentSize.value();
535 const auto &curSize = attachment.getSize();
536 return (curSize.width != prevSize.width || curSize.height != prevSize.height);
537 };
538
539 for (const auto &attachment : mColorAttachments)
540 {
541 if (hasMismatchedSize(attachment))
542 {
543 return false;
544 }
545 }
546
547 if (hasMismatchedSize(mDepthAttachment))
548 {
549 return false;
550 }
551
552 return !hasMismatchedSize(mStencilAttachment);
553}
554
555bool FramebufferState::hasSeparateDepthAndStencilAttachments() const
556{
557 // if we have both a depth and stencil buffer, they must refer to the same object
558 // since we only support packed_depth_stencil and not separate depth and stencil
559 return (getDepthAttachment() != nullptr && getStencilAttachment() != nullptr &&
560 getDepthStencilAttachment() == nullptr);
561}
562
563const FramebufferAttachment *FramebufferState::getDrawBuffer(size_t drawBufferIdx) const
564{
565 ASSERT(drawBufferIdx < mDrawBufferStates.size());
566 if (mDrawBufferStates[drawBufferIdx] != GL_NONE)
567 {
568 // ES3 spec: "If the GL is bound to a draw framebuffer object, the ith buffer listed in bufs
569 // must be COLOR_ATTACHMENTi or NONE"
570 ASSERT(mDrawBufferStates[drawBufferIdx] == GL_COLOR_ATTACHMENT0 + drawBufferIdx ||
571 (drawBufferIdx == 0 && mDrawBufferStates[drawBufferIdx] == GL_BACK));
572
573 if (mDrawBufferStates[drawBufferIdx] == GL_BACK)
574 {
575 return getColorAttachment(0);
576 }
577 else
578 {
579 return getColorAttachment(mDrawBufferStates[drawBufferIdx] - GL_COLOR_ATTACHMENT0);
580 }
581 }
582 else
583 {
584 return nullptr;
585 }
586}
587
588size_t FramebufferState::getDrawBufferCount() const
589{
590 return mDrawBufferStates.size();
591}
592
593bool FramebufferState::colorAttachmentsAreUniqueImages() const
594{
595 for (size_t firstAttachmentIdx = 0; firstAttachmentIdx < mColorAttachments.size();
596 firstAttachmentIdx++)
597 {
598 const FramebufferAttachment &firstAttachment = mColorAttachments[firstAttachmentIdx];
599 if (!firstAttachment.isAttached())
600 {
601 continue;
602 }
603
604 for (size_t secondAttachmentIdx = firstAttachmentIdx + 1;
605 secondAttachmentIdx < mColorAttachments.size(); secondAttachmentIdx++)
606 {
607 const FramebufferAttachment &secondAttachment = mColorAttachments[secondAttachmentIdx];
608 if (!secondAttachment.isAttached())
609 {
610 continue;
611 }
612
613 if (firstAttachment == secondAttachment)
614 {
615 return false;
616 }
617 }
618 }
619
620 return true;
621}
622
623bool FramebufferState::hasDepth() const
624{
625 return (mDepthAttachment.isAttached() && mDepthAttachment.getDepthSize() > 0);
626}
627
628bool FramebufferState::hasStencil() const
629{
630 return (mStencilAttachment.isAttached() && mStencilAttachment.getStencilSize() > 0);
631}
632
633bool FramebufferState::isMultiview() const
634{
635 const FramebufferAttachment *attachment = getFirstNonNullAttachment();
636 if (attachment == nullptr)
637 {
638 return false;
639 }
640 return attachment->isMultiview();
641}
642
643int FramebufferState::getBaseViewIndex() const
644{
645 const FramebufferAttachment *attachment = getFirstNonNullAttachment();
646 if (attachment == nullptr)
647 {
648 return GL_NONE;
649 }
650 return attachment->getBaseViewIndex();
651}
652
653Box FramebufferState::getDimensions() const
654{
655 Extents extents = getExtents();
656 return Box(0, 0, 0, extents.width, extents.height, extents.depth);
657}
658
659Extents FramebufferState::getExtents() const
660{
661 ASSERT(attachmentsHaveSameDimensions());
662 const FramebufferAttachment *first = getFirstNonNullAttachment();
663 if (first)
664 {
665 return first->getSize();
666 }
667 return Extents(getDefaultWidth(), getDefaultHeight(), 0);
668}
669
670bool FramebufferState::isDefault() const
671{
672 return mId == Framebuffer::kDefaultDrawFramebufferHandle;
673}
674
675const FramebufferID Framebuffer::kDefaultDrawFramebufferHandle = {0};
676
677Framebuffer::Framebuffer(const Caps &caps,
678 rx::GLImplFactory *factory,
679 FramebufferID id,
680 egl::ShareGroup *shareGroup)
681 : mState(caps, id, shareGroup->generateFramebufferSerial()),
682 mImpl(factory->createFramebuffer(mState)),
683 mCachedStatus(),
684 mDirtyDepthAttachmentBinding(this, DIRTY_BIT_DEPTH_ATTACHMENT),
685 mDirtyStencilAttachmentBinding(this, DIRTY_BIT_STENCIL_ATTACHMENT)
686{
687 ASSERT(mImpl != nullptr);
688 ASSERT(mState.mColorAttachments.size() == static_cast<size_t>(caps.maxColorAttachments));
689
690 for (uint32_t colorIndex = 0;
691 colorIndex < static_cast<uint32_t>(mState.mColorAttachments.size()); ++colorIndex)
692 {
693 mDirtyColorAttachmentBindings.emplace_back(this, DIRTY_BIT_COLOR_ATTACHMENT_0 + colorIndex);
694 }
695 mDirtyBits.set(DIRTY_BIT_READ_BUFFER);
696}
697
698Framebuffer::Framebuffer(const Context *context, egl::Surface *surface, egl::Surface *readSurface)
699 : mState(context->getShareGroup()->generateFramebufferSerial()),
700 mImpl(surface->getImplementation()->createDefaultFramebuffer(context, mState)),
701 mCachedStatus(GL_FRAMEBUFFER_COMPLETE),
702 mDirtyDepthAttachmentBinding(this, DIRTY_BIT_DEPTH_ATTACHMENT),
703 mDirtyStencilAttachmentBinding(this, DIRTY_BIT_STENCIL_ATTACHMENT)
704{
705 ASSERT(mImpl != nullptr);
706
707 mDirtyColorAttachmentBindings.emplace_back(this, DIRTY_BIT_COLOR_ATTACHMENT_0);
708 setAttachmentImpl(context, GL_FRAMEBUFFER_DEFAULT, GL_BACK, ImageIndex(), surface,
709 FramebufferAttachment::kDefaultNumViews,
710 FramebufferAttachment::kDefaultBaseViewIndex, false,
711 FramebufferAttachment::kDefaultRenderToTextureSamples);
712
713 setReadSurface(context, readSurface);
714
715 if (surface->getConfig()->depthSize > 0)
716 {
717 setAttachmentImpl(context, GL_FRAMEBUFFER_DEFAULT, GL_DEPTH, ImageIndex(), surface,
718 FramebufferAttachment::kDefaultNumViews,
719 FramebufferAttachment::kDefaultBaseViewIndex, false,
720 FramebufferAttachment::kDefaultRenderToTextureSamples);
721 }
722
723 if (surface->getConfig()->stencilSize > 0)
724 {
725 setAttachmentImpl(context, GL_FRAMEBUFFER_DEFAULT, GL_STENCIL, ImageIndex(), surface,
726 FramebufferAttachment::kDefaultNumViews,
727 FramebufferAttachment::kDefaultBaseViewIndex, false,
728 FramebufferAttachment::kDefaultRenderToTextureSamples);
729 }
730 SetComponentTypeMask(getDrawbufferWriteType(0), 0, &mState.mDrawBufferTypeMask);
731
732 mState.mSurfaceTextureOffset = surface->getTextureOffset();
733
734 // Ensure the backend has a chance to synchronize its content for a new backbuffer.
735 mDirtyBits.set(DIRTY_BIT_COLOR_BUFFER_CONTENTS_0);
736}
737
738Framebuffer::Framebuffer(const Context *context,
739 rx::GLImplFactory *factory,
740 egl::Surface *readSurface)
741 : mState(context->getShareGroup()->generateFramebufferSerial()),
742 mImpl(factory->createFramebuffer(mState)),
743 mCachedStatus(GL_FRAMEBUFFER_UNDEFINED_OES),
744 mDirtyDepthAttachmentBinding(this, DIRTY_BIT_DEPTH_ATTACHMENT),
745 mDirtyStencilAttachmentBinding(this, DIRTY_BIT_STENCIL_ATTACHMENT)
746{
747 mDirtyColorAttachmentBindings.emplace_back(this, DIRTY_BIT_COLOR_ATTACHMENT_0);
748 SetComponentTypeMask(getDrawbufferWriteType(0), 0, &mState.mDrawBufferTypeMask);
749
750 setReadSurface(context, readSurface);
751}
752
753Framebuffer::~Framebuffer()
754{
755 SafeDelete(mImpl);
756}
757
758void Framebuffer::onDestroy(const Context *context)
759{
760 if (isDefault())
761 {
762 mState.mDefaultFramebufferReadAttachment.detach(context, mState.mFramebufferSerial);
763 mState.mDefaultFramebufferReadAttachmentInitialized = false;
764 }
765
766 for (auto &attachment : mState.mColorAttachments)
767 {
768 attachment.detach(context, mState.mFramebufferSerial);
769 }
770 mState.mDepthAttachment.detach(context, mState.mFramebufferSerial);
771 mState.mStencilAttachment.detach(context, mState.mFramebufferSerial);
772 mState.mWebGLDepthAttachment.detach(context, mState.mFramebufferSerial);
773 mState.mWebGLStencilAttachment.detach(context, mState.mFramebufferSerial);
774 mState.mWebGLDepthStencilAttachment.detach(context, mState.mFramebufferSerial);
775
776 mImpl->destroy(context);
777}
778
779void Framebuffer::setReadSurface(const Context *context, egl::Surface *readSurface)
780{
781 // updateAttachment() without mState.mResourceNeedsInit.set()
782 mState.mDefaultFramebufferReadAttachment.attach(
783 context, GL_FRAMEBUFFER_DEFAULT, GL_BACK, ImageIndex(), readSurface,
784 FramebufferAttachment::kDefaultNumViews, FramebufferAttachment::kDefaultBaseViewIndex,
785 false, FramebufferAttachment::kDefaultRenderToTextureSamples, mState.mFramebufferSerial);
786 mDirtyBits.set(DIRTY_BIT_READ_BUFFER);
787}
788
789void Framebuffer::setLabel(const Context *context, const std::string &label)
790{
791 mState.mLabel = label;
792}
793
794const std::string &Framebuffer::getLabel() const
795{
796 return mState.mLabel;
797}
798
799bool Framebuffer::detachTexture(const Context *context, TextureID textureId)
800{
801 return detachResourceById(context, GL_TEXTURE, textureId.value);
802}
803
804bool Framebuffer::detachRenderbuffer(const Context *context, RenderbufferID renderbufferId)
805{
806 return detachResourceById(context, GL_RENDERBUFFER, renderbufferId.value);
807}
808
809bool Framebuffer::detachResourceById(const Context *context, GLenum resourceType, GLuint resourceId)
810{
811 bool found = false;
812
813 for (size_t colorIndex = 0; colorIndex < mState.mColorAttachments.size(); ++colorIndex)
814 {
815 if (detachMatchingAttachment(context, &mState.mColorAttachments[colorIndex], resourceType,
816 resourceId))
817 {
818 found = true;
819 }
820 }
821
822 if (context->isWebGL1())
823 {
824 const std::array<FramebufferAttachment *, 3> attachments = {
825 {&mState.mWebGLDepthStencilAttachment, &mState.mWebGLDepthAttachment,
826 &mState.mWebGLStencilAttachment}};
827 for (FramebufferAttachment *attachment : attachments)
828 {
829 if (detachMatchingAttachment(context, attachment, resourceType, resourceId))
830 {
831 found = true;
832 }
833 }
834 }
835 else
836 {
837 if (detachMatchingAttachment(context, &mState.mDepthAttachment, resourceType, resourceId))
838 {
839 found = true;
840 }
841 if (detachMatchingAttachment(context, &mState.mStencilAttachment, resourceType, resourceId))
842 {
843 found = true;
844 }
845 }
846
847 return found;
848}
849
850bool Framebuffer::detachMatchingAttachment(const Context *context,
851 FramebufferAttachment *attachment,
852 GLenum matchType,
853 GLuint matchId)
854{
855 if (attachment->isAttached() && attachment->type() == matchType && attachment->id() == matchId)
856 {
857 // We go through resetAttachment to make sure that all the required bookkeeping will be done
858 // such as updating enabled draw buffer state.
859 resetAttachment(context, attachment->getBinding());
860 return true;
861 }
862
863 return false;
864}
865

867{
868 return mState.getColorAttachment(colorAttachment);
869}

927
928GLenum Framebuffer::getDrawBufferState(size_t drawBuffer) const
929{
930 ASSERT(drawBuffer < mState.mDrawBufferStates.size());
931 return mState.mDrawBufferStates[drawBuffer];
932}
933
934const std::vector<GLenum> &Framebuffer::getDrawBufferStates() const
935{
936 return mState.getDrawBufferStates();
937}
938
939void Framebuffer::setDrawBuffers(size_t count, const GLenum *buffers)
940{
941 auto &drawStates = mState.mDrawBufferStates;
942
943 ASSERT(count <= drawStates.size());
944 std::copy(buffers, buffers + count, drawStates.begin());
945 std::fill(drawStates.begin() + count, drawStates.end(), GL_NONE);
946 mDirtyBits.set(DIRTY_BIT_DRAW_BUFFERS);
947
948 mState.mEnabledDrawBuffers.reset();
949 mState.mDrawBufferTypeMask.reset();
950
951 for (size_t index = 0; index < count; ++index)
952 {
953 SetComponentTypeMask(getDrawbufferWriteType(index), index, &mState.mDrawBufferTypeMask);
954
955 if (drawStates[index] != GL_NONE && mState.mColorAttachments[index].isAttached())
956 {
957 mState.mEnabledDrawBuffers.set(index);
958 }
959 }
960}
961
962const FramebufferAttachment *Framebuffer::getDrawBuffer(size_t drawBuffer) const
963{
964 return mState.getDrawBuffer(drawBuffer);
965}
966
967ComponentType Framebuffer::getDrawbufferWriteType(size_t drawBuffer) const
968{
969 const FramebufferAttachment *attachment = mState.getDrawBuffer(drawBuffer);
970 if (attachment == nullptr)
971 {
972 return ComponentType::NoType;
973 }
974
975 GLenum componentType = attachment->getFormat().info->componentType;
976 switch (componentType)
977 {
978 case GL_INT:
979 return ComponentType::Int;
980 case GL_UNSIGNED_INT:
981 return ComponentType::UnsignedInt;
982
983 default:
984 return ComponentType::Float;
985 }
986}
987
988ComponentTypeMask Framebuffer::getDrawBufferTypeMask() const
989{
990 return mState.mDrawBufferTypeMask;
991}
992
993DrawBufferMask Framebuffer::getDrawBufferMask() const
994{
995 return mState.mEnabledDrawBuffers;
996}
997
998bool Framebuffer::hasEnabledDrawBuffer() const
999{
1000 for (size_t drawbufferIdx = 0; drawbufferIdx < mState.mDrawBufferStates.size(); ++drawbufferIdx)
1001 {
1002 if (getDrawBuffer(drawbufferIdx) != nullptr)
1003 {
1004 return true;
1005 }
1006 }
1007
1008 return false;
1009}
1010
1011GLenum Framebuffer::getReadBufferState() const
1012{
1013 return mState.mReadBufferState;
1014}
1015
1016void Framebuffer::setReadBuffer(GLenum buffer)
1017{
1018 ASSERT(buffer == GL_BACK || buffer == GL_NONE ||
1019 (buffer >= GL_COLOR_ATTACHMENT0 &&
1020 (buffer - GL_COLOR_ATTACHMENT0) < mState.mColorAttachments.size()));
1021 mState.mReadBufferState = buffer;
1022 mDirtyBits.set(DIRTY_BIT_READ_BUFFER);
1023}

1038}
1039
1040bool Framebuffer::usingExtendedDrawBuffers() const
1041{
1042 for (size_t drawbufferIdx = 1; drawbufferIdx < mState.mDrawBufferStates.size(); ++drawbufferIdx)
1043 {
1044 if (getDrawBuffer(drawbufferIdx) != nullptr)
1045 {
1046 return true;
1047 }
1048 }
1049
1050 return false;
1051}
1052
1053void Framebuffer::invalidateCompletenessCache()
1054{
1055 if (!isDefault())
1056 {
1057 mCachedStatus.reset();
1058 }
1059 onStateChange(angle::SubjectMessage::DirtyBitsFlagged);
1060}
1061
1062GLenum Framebuffer::checkStatusImpl(const Context *context) const
1063{
1064 ASSERT(!isDefault());
1065 ASSERT(hasAnyDirtyBit() || !mCachedStatus.valid());
1066
1067 mCachedStatus = checkStatusWithGLFrontEnd(context);
1068
1069 if (mCachedStatus.value() == GL_FRAMEBUFFER_COMPLETE)
1070 {
1071 // We can skip syncState on several back-ends.
1072 if (mImpl->shouldSyncStateBeforeCheckStatus())
1073 {
1074 // This binding is not totally correct. It is ok because the parameter isn't used in
1075 // the GL back-end and the GL back-end is the only user of syncStateBeforeCheckStatus.
1076 angle::Result err = syncState(context, GL_FRAMEBUFFER, Command::Other);
1077 if (err != angle::Result::Continue)
1078 {
1079 return 0;
1080 }
1081 }
1082
1083 if (!mImpl->checkStatus(context))
1084 {
1085 mCachedStatus = GL_FRAMEBUFFER_UNSUPPORTED;
1086 }
1087 }
1088
1089 return mCachedStatus.value();
1090}
1091
1092GLenum Framebuffer::checkStatusWithGLFrontEnd(const Context *context) const
1093{
1094 const State &state = context->getState();
1095
1096 ASSERT(!isDefault());
1097
1098 bool hasAttachments = false;
1099 Optional<unsigned int> colorbufferSize;
1100 Optional<int> samples;
1101 Optional<bool> fixedSampleLocations;
1102 bool hasRenderbuffer = false;
1103 Optional<int> renderToTextureSamples;
1104
1105 const FramebufferAttachment *firstAttachment = getFirstNonNullAttachment();
1106
1107 Optional<bool> isLayered;
1108 Optional<TextureType> colorAttachmentsTextureType;
1109
1110 for (const FramebufferAttachment &colorAttachment : mState.mColorAttachments)
1111 {
1112 if (colorAttachment.isAttached())
1113 {
1114 if (!CheckAttachmentCompleteness(context, colorAttachment))
1115 {
1116 return GL_FRAMEBUFFER_INCOMPLETE_ATTACHMENT;
1117 }
1118
1119 const InternalFormat &format = *colorAttachment.getFormat().info;
1120 if (format.depthBits > 0 || format.stencilBits > 0)
1121 {
1122 return GL_FRAMEBUFFER_INCOMPLETE_ATTACHMENT;
1123 }
1124
1125 if (!CheckAttachmentSampleCompleteness(context, colorAttachment, true, &samples,
1126 &fixedSampleLocations, &renderToTextureSamples))
1127 {
1128 return GL_FRAMEBUFFER_INCOMPLETE_MULTISAMPLE;
1129 }
1130
1131 // in GLES 2.0, all color attachments attachments must have the same number of bitplanes
1132 // in GLES 3.0, there is no such restriction
1133 if (state.getClientMajorVersion() < 3)
1134 {
1135 if (colorbufferSize.valid())
1136 {
1137 if (format.pixelBytes != colorbufferSize.value())
1138 {
1139 return GL_FRAMEBUFFER_UNSUPPORTED;
1140 }
1141 }
1142 else
1143 {
1144 colorbufferSize = format.pixelBytes;
1145 }
1146 }
1147
1148 if (!CheckMultiviewStateMatchesForCompleteness(firstAttachment, &colorAttachment))
1149 {
1150 return GL_FRAMEBUFFER_INCOMPLETE_VIEW_TARGETS_OVR;
1151 }
1152
1153 hasRenderbuffer = hasRenderbuffer || (colorAttachment.type() == GL_RENDERBUFFER);
1154
1155 if (!hasAttachments)
1156 {
1157 isLayered = colorAttachment.isLayered();
1158 if (isLayered.value())
1159 {
1160 colorAttachmentsTextureType = colorAttachment.getTextureImageIndex().getType();
1161 }
1162 hasAttachments = true;
1163 }
1164 else
1165 {
1166 // [EXT_geometry_shader] section 9.4.1, "Framebuffer Completeness"
1167 // If any framebuffer attachment is layered, all populated attachments
1168 // must be layered. Additionally, all populated color attachments must
1169 // be from textures of the same target. {FRAMEBUFFER_INCOMPLETE_LAYER_TARGETS_EXT }
1170 ASSERT(isLayered.valid());
1171 if (isLayered.value() != colorAttachment.isLayered())
1172 {
1173 return GL_FRAMEBUFFER_INCOMPLETE_LAYER_TARGETS_EXT;
1174 }
1175 else if (isLayered.value())
1176 {
1177 ASSERT(colorAttachmentsTextureType.valid());
1178 if (colorAttachmentsTextureType.value() !=
1179 colorAttachment.getTextureImageIndex().getType())
1180 {
1181 return GL_FRAMEBUFFER_INCOMPLETE_LAYER_TARGETS_EXT;
1182 }
1183 }
1184 }
1185 }
1186 }
1187
1188 const FramebufferAttachment &depthAttachment = mState.mDepthAttachment;
1189 if (depthAttachment.isAttached())
1190 {
1191 if (!CheckAttachmentCompleteness(context, depthAttachment))
1192 {
1193 return GL_FRAMEBUFFER_INCOMPLETE_ATTACHMENT;
1194 }
1195
1196 const InternalFormat &format = *depthAttachment.getFormat().info;
1197 if (format.depthBits == 0)
1198 {
1199 return GL_FRAMEBUFFER_INCOMPLETE_ATTACHMENT;
1200 }
1201
1202 if (!CheckAttachmentSampleCompleteness(context, depthAttachment, false, &samples,
1203 &fixedSampleLocations, &renderToTextureSamples))
1204 {
1205 return GL_FRAMEBUFFER_INCOMPLETE_MULTISAMPLE;
1206 }
1207
1208 if (!CheckMultiviewStateMatchesForCompleteness(firstAttachment, &depthAttachment))
1209 {
1210 return GL_FRAMEBUFFER_INCOMPLETE_VIEW_TARGETS_OVR;
1211 }
1212
1213 hasRenderbuffer = hasRenderbuffer || (depthAttachment.type() == GL_RENDERBUFFER);
1214
1215 if (!hasAttachments)
1216 {
1217 isLayered = depthAttachment.isLayered();
1218 hasAttachments = true;
1219 }
1220 else
1221 {
1222 // [EXT_geometry_shader] section 9.4.1, "Framebuffer Completeness"
1223 // If any framebuffer attachment is layered, all populated attachments
1224 // must be layered. {FRAMEBUFFER_INCOMPLETE_LAYER_TARGETS_EXT }
1225 ASSERT(isLayered.valid());
1226 if (isLayered.value() != depthAttachment.isLayered())
1227 {
1228 return GL_FRAMEBUFFER_INCOMPLETE_LAYER_TARGETS_EXT;
1229 }
1230 }
1231 }
1232
1233 const FramebufferAttachment &stencilAttachment = mState.mStencilAttachment;
1234 if (stencilAttachment.isAttached())
1235 {
1236 if (!CheckAttachmentCompleteness(context, stencilAttachment))
1237 {
1238 return GL_FRAMEBUFFER_INCOMPLETE_ATTACHMENT;
1239 }
1240
1241 const InternalFormat &format = *stencilAttachment.getFormat().info;
1242 if (format.stencilBits == 0)
1243 {
1244 return GL_FRAMEBUFFER_INCOMPLETE_ATTACHMENT;
1245 }
1246
1247 if (!CheckAttachmentSampleCompleteness(context, stencilAttachment, false, &samples,
1248 &fixedSampleLocations, &renderToTextureSamples))
1249 {
1250 return GL_FRAMEBUFFER_INCOMPLETE_MULTISAMPLE;
1251 }
1252
1253 if (!CheckMultiviewStateMatchesForCompleteness(firstAttachment, &stencilAttachment))
1254 {
1255 return GL_FRAMEBUFFER_INCOMPLETE_VIEW_TARGETS_OVR;
1256 }
1257
1258 hasRenderbuffer = hasRenderbuffer || (stencilAttachment.type() == GL_RENDERBUFFER);
1259
1260 if (!hasAttachments)
1261 {
1262 hasAttachments = true;
1263 }
1264 else
1265 {
1266 // [EXT_geometry_shader] section 9.4.1, "Framebuffer Completeness"
1267 // If any framebuffer attachment is layered, all populated attachments
1268 // must be layered.
1269 // {FRAMEBUFFER_INCOMPLETE_LAYER_TARGETS_EXT }
1270 ASSERT(isLayered.valid());
1271 if (isLayered.value() != stencilAttachment.isLayered())
1272 {
1273 return GL_FRAMEBUFFER_INCOMPLETE_LAYER_TARGETS_EXT;
1274 }
1275 }
1276 }
1277
1278 // Starting from ES 3.0 stencil and depth, if present, should be the same image
1279 if (state.getClientMajorVersion() >= 3 && depthAttachment.isAttached() &&
1280 stencilAttachment.isAttached() && stencilAttachment != depthAttachment)
1281 {
1282 return GL_FRAMEBUFFER_UNSUPPORTED;
1283 }
1284
1285 // Special additional validation for WebGL 1 DEPTH/STENCIL/DEPTH_STENCIL.
1286 if (state.isWebGL1())
1287 {
1288 if (!mState.mWebGLDepthStencilConsistent)
1289 {
1290 return GL_FRAMEBUFFER_UNSUPPORTED;
1291 }
1292
1293 if (mState.mWebGLDepthStencilAttachment.isAttached())
1294 {
1295 if (mState.mWebGLDepthStencilAttachment.getDepthSize() == 0 ||
1296 mState.mWebGLDepthStencilAttachment.getStencilSize() == 0)
1297 {
1298 return GL_FRAMEBUFFER_INCOMPLETE_ATTACHMENT;
1299 }
1300
1301 if (!CheckMultiviewStateMatchesForCompleteness(firstAttachment,
1302 &mState.mWebGLDepthStencilAttachment))
1303 {
1304 return GL_FRAMEBUFFER_INCOMPLETE_VIEW_TARGETS_OVR;
1305 }
1306 }
1307 else if (mState.mStencilAttachment.isAttached() &&
1308 mState.mStencilAttachment.getDepthSize() > 0)
1309 {
1310 return GL_FRAMEBUFFER_INCOMPLETE_ATTACHMENT;
1311 }
1312 else if (mState.mDepthAttachment.isAttached() &&
1313 mState.mDepthAttachment.getStencilSize() > 0)
1314 {
1315 return GL_FRAMEBUFFER_INCOMPLETE_ATTACHMENT;
1316 }
1317 }
1318
1319 // ES3.1(section 9.4) requires that if no image is attached to the framebuffer, and either the
1320 // value of the framebuffer's FRAMEBUFFER_DEFAULT_WIDTH or FRAMEBUFFER_DEFAULT_HEIGHT parameters
1321 // is zero, the framebuffer is considered incomplete.
1322 GLint defaultWidth = mState.getDefaultWidth();
1323 GLint defaultHeight = mState.getDefaultHeight();
1324 if (!hasAttachments && (defaultWidth == 0 || defaultHeight == 0))
1325 {
1326 return GL_FRAMEBUFFER_INCOMPLETE_MISSING_ATTACHMENT;
1327 }
1328
1329 // In ES 2.0 and WebGL, all color attachments must have the same width and height.
1330 // In ES 3.0, there is no such restriction.
1331 if ((state.getClientMajorVersion() < 3 || state.getExtensions().webglCompatibility) &&
1332 !mState.attachmentsHaveSameDimensions())
1333 {
1334 return GL_FRAMEBUFFER_INCOMPLETE_DIMENSIONS;
1335 }
1336
1337 // ES3.1(section 9.4) requires that if the attached images are a mix of renderbuffers and
1338 // textures, the value of TEXTURE_FIXED_SAMPLE_LOCATIONS must be TRUE for all attached textures.
1339 if (fixedSampleLocations.valid() && hasRenderbuffer && !fixedSampleLocations.value())
1340 {
1341 return GL_FRAMEBUFFER_INCOMPLETE_MULTISAMPLE;
1342 }
1343
1344 // The WebGL conformance tests implicitly define that all framebuffer
1345 // attachments must be unique. For example, the same level of a texture can
1346 // not be attached to two different color attachments.
1347 if (state.getExtensions().webglCompatibility)
1348 {
1349 if (!mState.colorAttachmentsAreUniqueImages())
1350 {
1351 return GL_FRAMEBUFFER_UNSUPPORTED;
1352 }
1353 }
1354
1355 return GL_FRAMEBUFFER_COMPLETE;
1356}
1357
1358angle::Result Framebuffer::discard(const Context *context, size_t count, const GLenum *attachments)
1359{
1360 // Back-ends might make the contents of the FBO undefined. In WebGL 2.0, invalidate operations
1361 // can be no-ops, so we should probably do that to ensure consistency.
1362 // TODO(jmadill): WebGL behaviour, and robust resource init behaviour without WebGL.
1363
1364 return mImpl->discard(context, count, attachments);
1365}
1366
1367angle::Result Framebuffer::invalidate(const Context *context,
1368 size_t count,
1369 const GLenum *attachments)
1370{
1371 // Back-ends might make the contents of the FBO undefined. In WebGL 2.0, invalidate operations
1372 // can be no-ops, so we should probably do that to ensure consistency.
1373 // TODO(jmadill): WebGL behaviour, and robust resource init behaviour without WebGL.
1374
1375 return mImpl->invalidate(context, count, attachments);
1376}
1377
1378bool Framebuffer::partialClearNeedsInit(const Context *context,
1379 bool color,
1380 bool depth,
1381 bool stencil)
1382{
1383 const auto &glState = context->getState();
1384
1385 if (!glState.isRobustResourceInitEnabled())
1386 {
1387 return false;
1388 }
1389
1390 // Scissors can affect clearing.
1391 // TODO(jmadill): Check for complete scissor overlap.
1392 if (glState.isScissorTestEnabled())
1393 {
1394 return true;
1395 }
1396
1397 // If colors masked, we must clear before we clear. Do a simple check.
1398 // TODO(jmadill): Filter out unused color channels from the test.
1399 if (color && glState.anyActiveDrawBufferChannelMasked())
1400 {
1401 return true;
1402 }
1403
1404 const auto &depthStencil = glState.getDepthStencilState();
1405 if (stencil && (depthStencil.stencilMask != depthStencil.stencilWritemask ||
1406 depthStencil.stencilBackMask != depthStencil.stencilBackWritemask))
1407 {
1408 return true;
1409 }
1410
1411 return false;
1412}
1413
1414angle::Result Framebuffer::invalidateSub(const Context *context,
1415 size_t count,
1416 const GLenum *attachments,
1417 const Rectangle &area)
1418{
1419 // Back-ends might make the contents of the FBO undefined. In WebGL 2.0, invalidate operations
1420 // can be no-ops, so we should probably do that to ensure consistency.
1421 // TODO(jmadill): Make a invalidate no-op in WebGL 2.0.
1422
1423 return mImpl->invalidateSub(context, count, attachments, area);
1424}
1425
1426angle::Result Framebuffer::clear(const Context *context, GLbitfield mask)
1427{
1428 ASSERT(mask && !context->getState().isRasterizerDiscardEnabled());
1429
1430 return mImpl->clear(context, mask);
1431}
1432
1433angle::Result Framebuffer::clearBufferfv(const Context *context,
1434 GLenum buffer,
1435 GLint drawbuffer,
1436 const GLfloat *values)
1437{
1438 return mImpl->clearBufferfv(context, buffer, drawbuffer, values);
1439}
1440
1441angle::Result Framebuffer::clearBufferuiv(const Context *context,
1442 GLenum buffer,
1443 GLint drawbuffer,
1444 const GLuint *values)
1445{
1446 return mImpl->clearBufferuiv(context, buffer, drawbuffer, values);
1447}
1448
1449angle::Result Framebuffer::clearBufferiv(const Context *context,
1450 GLenum buffer,
1451 GLint drawbuffer,
1452 const GLint *values)
1453{
1454 return mImpl->clearBufferiv(context, buffer, drawbuffer, values);
1455}
1456
1457angle::Result Framebuffer::clearBufferfi(const Context *context,
1458 GLenum buffer,
1459 GLint drawbuffer,
1460 GLfloat depth,
1461 GLint stencil)
1462{
1463 const bool clearDepth =
1464 getDepthAttachment() != nullptr && context->getState().getDepthStencilState().depthMask;
1465 const bool clearStencil = getStencilAttachment() != nullptr &&
1466 context->getState().getDepthStencilState().stencilWritemask != 0;
1467
1468 if (clearDepth && clearStencil)
1469 {
1470 ASSERT(buffer == GL_DEPTH_STENCIL);
1471 ANGLE_TRY(mImpl->clearBufferfi(context, GL_DEPTH_STENCIL, drawbuffer, depth, stencil));
1472 }
1473 else if (clearDepth && !clearStencil)
1474 {
1475 ANGLE_TRY(mImpl->clearBufferfv(context, GL_DEPTH, drawbuffer, &depth));
1476 }
1477 else if (!clearDepth && clearStencil)
1478 {
1479 ANGLE_TRY(mImpl->clearBufferiv(context, GL_STENCIL, drawbuffer, &stencil));
1480 }
1481
1482 return angle::Result::Continue;
1483}
1484
1485GLenum Framebuffer::getImplementationColorReadFormat(const Context *context)
1486{
1487 const gl::InternalFormat &format = mImpl->getImplementationColorReadFormat(context);
1488 return format.getReadPixelsFormat(context->getExtensions());
1489}
1490
1491GLenum Framebuffer::getImplementationColorReadType(const Context *context)
1492{
1493 const gl::InternalFormat &format = mImpl->getImplementationColorReadFormat(context);
1494 return format.getReadPixelsType(context->getClientVersion());
1495}
1496
1497angle::Result Framebuffer::readPixels(const Context *context,
1498 const Rectangle &area,
1499 GLenum format,
1500 GLenum type,
1501 const PixelPackState &pack,
1502 Buffer *packBuffer,
1503 void *pixels)
1504{
1505 ANGLE_TRY(mImpl->readPixels(context, area, format, type, pack, packBuffer, pixels));
1506
1507 if (packBuffer)
1508 {
1509 packBuffer->onDataChanged();
1510 }
1511
1512 return angle::Result::Continue;
1513}
1514
1515angle::Result Framebuffer::blit(const Context *context,
1516 const Rectangle &sourceArea,
1517 const Rectangle &destArea,
1518 GLbitfield mask,
1519 GLenum filter)
1520{
1521 ASSERT(mask != 0);
1522
1523 ANGLE_TRY(mImpl->blit(context, sourceArea, destArea, mask, filter));
1524
1525 // Mark the contents of the attachments dirty
1526 if ((mask & GL_COLOR_BUFFER_BIT) != 0)
1527 {
1528 for (size_t colorIndex : mState.mEnabledDrawBuffers)
1529 {
1530 mDirtyBits.set(DIRTY_BIT_COLOR_BUFFER_CONTENTS_0 + colorIndex);
1531 }
1532 }
1533 if ((mask & GL_DEPTH_BUFFER_BIT) != 0)
1534 {
1535 mDirtyBits.set(DIRTY_BIT_DEPTH_BUFFER_CONTENTS);
1536 }
1537 if ((mask & GL_STENCIL_BUFFER_BIT) != 0)
1538 {
1539 mDirtyBits.set(DIRTY_BIT_STENCIL_BUFFER_CONTENTS);
1540 }
1541 onStateChange(angle::SubjectMessage::DirtyBitsFlagged);
1542
1543 return angle::Result::Continue;
1544}
1545
1546int Framebuffer::getSamples(const Context *context) const
1547{
1548 if (!isComplete(context))
1549 {
1550 return 0;
1551 }
1552
1553 ASSERT(mCachedStatus.valid() && mCachedStatus.value() == GL_FRAMEBUFFER_COMPLETE);
1554
1555 // For a complete framebuffer, all attachments must have the same sample count.
1556 // In this case return the first nonzero sample size.
1557 const FramebufferAttachment *firstNonNullAttachment = mState.getFirstNonNullAttachment();
1558 ASSERT(firstNonNullAttachment == nullptr || firstNonNullAttachment->isAttached());
1559
1560 return firstNonNullAttachment ? firstNonNullAttachment->getSamples() : 0;
1561}
1562
1563int Framebuffer::getReadBufferResourceSamples(const Context *context) const
1564{
1565 if (!isComplete(context))
1566 {
1567 return 0;
1568 }
1569
1570 ASSERT(mCachedStatus.valid() && mCachedStatus.value() == GL_FRAMEBUFFER_COMPLETE);
1571
1572 const FramebufferAttachment *readAttachment = mState.getReadAttachment();
1573 ASSERT(readAttachment == nullptr || readAttachment->isAttached());
1574
1575 return readAttachment ? readAttachment->getResourceSamples() : 0;
1576}
1577
1578angle::Result Framebuffer::getSamplePosition(const Context *context,
1579 size_t index,
1580 GLfloat *xy) const
1581{
1582 ANGLE_TRY(mImpl->getSamplePosition(context, index, xy));
1583 return angle::Result::Continue;
1584}
1585
1586bool Framebuffer::hasValidDepthStencil() const
1587{
1588 return mState.getDepthStencilAttachment() != nullptr;
1589}
1590
1591const gl::Offset &Framebuffer::getSurfaceTextureOffset() const
1592{
1593 return mState.getSurfaceTextureOffset();
1594}
1595
1596void Framebuffer::setAttachment(const Context *context,
1597 GLenum type,
1598 GLenum binding,
1599 const ImageIndex &textureIndex,
1600 FramebufferAttachmentObject *resource)
1601{
1602 setAttachment(context, type, binding, textureIndex, resource,
1603 FramebufferAttachment::kDefaultNumViews,
1604 FramebufferAttachment::kDefaultBaseViewIndex, false,
1605 FramebufferAttachment::kDefaultRenderToTextureSamples);
1606}
1607
1608void Framebuffer::setAttachmentMultisample(const Context *context,
1609 GLenum type,
1610 GLenum binding,
1611 const ImageIndex &textureIndex,
1612 FramebufferAttachmentObject *resource,
1613 GLsizei samples)
1614{
1615 setAttachment(context, type, binding, textureIndex, resource,
1616 FramebufferAttachment::kDefaultNumViews,
1617 FramebufferAttachment::kDefaultBaseViewIndex, false, samples);
1618}
1619
1620void Framebuffer::setAttachment(const Context *context,
1621 GLenum type,
1622 GLenum binding,
1623 const ImageIndex &textureIndex,
1624 FramebufferAttachmentObject *resource,
1625 GLsizei numViews,
1626 GLuint baseViewIndex,
1627 bool isMultiview,
1628 GLsizei samples)
1629{
1630 // Context may be null in unit tests.
1631 if (!context || !context->isWebGL1())
1632 {
1633 setAttachmentImpl(context, type, binding, textureIndex, resource, numViews, baseViewIndex,
1634 isMultiview, samples);
1635 return;
1636 }
1637
1638 switch (binding)
1639 {
1640 case GL_DEPTH_STENCIL:
1641 case GL_DEPTH_STENCIL_ATTACHMENT:
1642 mState.mWebGLDepthStencilAttachment.attach(
1643 context, type, binding, textureIndex, resource, numViews, baseViewIndex,
1644 isMultiview, samples, mState.mFramebufferSerial);
1645 break;
1646 case GL_DEPTH:
1647 case GL_DEPTH_ATTACHMENT:
1648 mState.mWebGLDepthAttachment.attach(context, type, binding, textureIndex, resource,
1649 numViews, baseViewIndex, isMultiview, samples,
1650 mState.mFramebufferSerial);
1651 break;
1652 case GL_STENCIL:
1653 case GL_STENCIL_ATTACHMENT:
1654 mState.mWebGLStencilAttachment.attach(context, type, binding, textureIndex, resource,
1655 numViews, baseViewIndex, isMultiview, samples,
1656 mState.mFramebufferSerial);
1657 break;
1658 default:
1659 setAttachmentImpl(context, type, binding, textureIndex, resource, numViews,
1660 baseViewIndex, isMultiview, samples);
1661 return;
1662 }
1663
1664 commitWebGL1DepthStencilIfConsistent(context, numViews, baseViewIndex, isMultiview, samples);
1665}
1666
1667void Framebuffer::setAttachmentMultiview(const Context *context,
1668 GLenum type,
1669 GLenum binding,
1670 const ImageIndex &textureIndex,
1671 FramebufferAttachmentObject *resource,
1672 GLsizei numViews,
1673 GLint baseViewIndex)
1674{
1675 setAttachment(context, type, binding, textureIndex, resource, numViews, baseViewIndex, true,
1676 FramebufferAttachment::kDefaultRenderToTextureSamples);
1677}
1678
1679void Framebuffer::commitWebGL1DepthStencilIfConsistent(const Context *context,
1680 GLsizei numViews,
1681 GLuint baseViewIndex,
1682 bool isMultiview,
1683 GLsizei samples)
1684{
1685 int count = 0;
1686
1687 std::array<FramebufferAttachment *, 3> attachments = {{&mState.mWebGLDepthStencilAttachment,
1688 &mState.mWebGLDepthAttachment,
1689 &mState.mWebGLStencilAttachment}};
1690 for (FramebufferAttachment *attachment : attachments)
1691 {
1692 if (attachment->isAttached())
1693 {
1694 count++;
1695 }
1696 }
1697
1698 mState.mWebGLDepthStencilConsistent = (count <= 1);
1699 if (!mState.mWebGLDepthStencilConsistent)
1700 {
1701 // Inconsistent.
1702 return;
1703 }
1704
1705 auto getImageIndexIfTextureAttachment = [](const FramebufferAttachment &attachment) {
1706 if (attachment.type() == GL_TEXTURE)
1707 {
1708 return attachment.getTextureImageIndex();
1709 }
1710 else
1711 {
1712 return ImageIndex();
1713 }
1714 };
1715
1716 if (mState.mWebGLDepthAttachment.isAttached())
1717 {
1718 const auto &depth = mState.mWebGLDepthAttachment;
1719 setAttachmentImpl(context, depth.type(), GL_DEPTH_ATTACHMENT,
1720 getImageIndexIfTextureAttachment(depth), depth.getResource(), numViews,
1721 baseViewIndex, isMultiview, samples);
1722 setAttachmentImpl(context, GL_NONE, GL_STENCIL_ATTACHMENT, ImageIndex(), nullptr, numViews,
1723 baseViewIndex, isMultiview, samples);
1724 }
1725 else if (mState.mWebGLStencilAttachment.isAttached())
1726 {
1727 const auto &stencil = mState.mWebGLStencilAttachment;
1728 setAttachmentImpl(context, GL_NONE, GL_DEPTH_ATTACHMENT, ImageIndex(), nullptr, numViews,
1729 baseViewIndex, isMultiview, samples);
1730 setAttachmentImpl(context, stencil.type(), GL_STENCIL_ATTACHMENT,
1731 getImageIndexIfTextureAttachment(stencil), stencil.getResource(),
1732 numViews, baseViewIndex, isMultiview, samples);
1733 }
1734 else if (mState.mWebGLDepthStencilAttachment.isAttached())
1735 {
1736 const auto &depthStencil = mState.mWebGLDepthStencilAttachment;
1737 setAttachmentImpl(context, depthStencil.type(), GL_DEPTH_ATTACHMENT,
1738 getImageIndexIfTextureAttachment(depthStencil),
1739 depthStencil.getResource(), numViews, baseViewIndex, isMultiview,
1740 samples);
1741 setAttachmentImpl(context, depthStencil.type(), GL_STENCIL_ATTACHMENT,
1742 getImageIndexIfTextureAttachment(depthStencil),
1743 depthStencil.getResource(), numViews, baseViewIndex, isMultiview,
1744 samples);
1745 }
1746 else
1747 {
1748 setAttachmentImpl(context, GL_NONE, GL_DEPTH_ATTACHMENT, ImageIndex(), nullptr, numViews,
1749 baseViewIndex, isMultiview, samples);
1750 setAttachmentImpl(context, GL_NONE, GL_STENCIL_ATTACHMENT, ImageIndex(), nullptr, numViews,
1751 baseViewIndex, isMultiview, samples);
1752 }
1753}
1754
1755void Framebuffer::setAttachmentImpl(const Context *context,
1756 GLenum type,
1757 GLenum binding,
1758 const ImageIndex &textureIndex,
1759 FramebufferAttachmentObject *resource,
1760 GLsizei numViews,
1761 GLuint baseViewIndex,
1762 bool isMultiview,
1763 GLsizei samples)
1764{
1765 switch (binding)
1766 {
1767 case GL_DEPTH_STENCIL:
1768 case GL_DEPTH_STENCIL_ATTACHMENT:
1769 updateAttachment(context, &mState.mDepthAttachment, DIRTY_BIT_DEPTH_ATTACHMENT,
1770 &mDirtyDepthAttachmentBinding, type, binding, textureIndex, resource,
1771 numViews, baseViewIndex, isMultiview, samples);
1772 updateAttachment(context, &mState.mStencilAttachment, DIRTY_BIT_STENCIL_ATTACHMENT,
1773 &mDirtyStencilAttachmentBinding, type, binding, textureIndex, resource,
1774 numViews, baseViewIndex, isMultiview, samples);
1775 break;
1776
1777 case GL_DEPTH:
1778 case GL_DEPTH_ATTACHMENT:
1779 updateAttachment(context, &mState.mDepthAttachment, DIRTY_BIT_DEPTH_ATTACHMENT,
1780 &mDirtyDepthAttachmentBinding, type, binding, textureIndex, resource,
1781 numViews, baseViewIndex, isMultiview, samples);
1782 break;
1783
1784 case GL_STENCIL:
1785 case GL_STENCIL_ATTACHMENT:
1786 updateAttachment(context, &mState.mStencilAttachment, DIRTY_BIT_STENCIL_ATTACHMENT,
1787 &mDirtyStencilAttachmentBinding, type, binding, textureIndex, resource,
1788 numViews, baseViewIndex, isMultiview, samples);
1789 break;
1790
1791 case GL_BACK:
1792 updateAttachment(context, &mState.mColorAttachments[0], DIRTY_BIT_COLOR_ATTACHMENT_0,
1793 &mDirtyColorAttachmentBindings[0], type, binding, textureIndex,
1794 resource, numViews, baseViewIndex, isMultiview, samples);
1795 mState.mColorAttachmentsMask.set(0);
1796
1797 break;
1798
1799 default:
1800 {
1801 size_t colorIndex = binding - GL_COLOR_ATTACHMENT0;
1802 ASSERT(colorIndex < mState.mColorAttachments.size());
1803 size_t dirtyBit = DIRTY_BIT_COLOR_ATTACHMENT_0 + colorIndex;
1804 updateAttachment(context, &mState.mColorAttachments[colorIndex], dirtyBit,
1805 &mDirtyColorAttachmentBindings[colorIndex], type, binding,
1806 textureIndex, resource, numViews, baseViewIndex, isMultiview, samples);
1807
1808 if (!resource)
1809 {
1810 mFloat32ColorAttachmentBits.reset(colorIndex);
1811 mState.mColorAttachmentsMask.reset(colorIndex);
1812 }
1813 else
1814 {
1815 updateFloat32ColorAttachmentBits(
1816 colorIndex, resource->getAttachmentFormat(binding, textureIndex).info);
1817 mState.mColorAttachmentsMask.set(colorIndex);
1818 }
1819
1820 bool enabled = (type != GL_NONE && getDrawBufferState(colorIndex) != GL_NONE);
1821 mState.mEnabledDrawBuffers.set(colorIndex, enabled);
1822 SetComponentTypeMask(getDrawbufferWriteType(colorIndex), colorIndex,
1823 &mState.mDrawBufferTypeMask);
1824 }
1825 break;
1826 }
1827}
1828
1829void Framebuffer::updateAttachment(const Context *context,
1830 FramebufferAttachment *attachment,
1831 size_t dirtyBit,
1832 angle::ObserverBinding *onDirtyBinding,
1833 GLenum type,
1834 GLenum binding,
1835 const ImageIndex &textureIndex,
1836 FramebufferAttachmentObject *resource,
1837 GLsizei numViews,
1838 GLuint baseViewIndex,
1839 bool isMultiview,
1840 GLsizei samples)
1841{
1842 attachment->attach(context, type, binding, textureIndex, resource, numViews, baseViewIndex,
1843 isMultiview, samples, mState.mFramebufferSerial);
1844 mDirtyBits.set(dirtyBit);
1845 mState.mResourceNeedsInit.set(dirtyBit, attachment->initState() == InitState::MayNeedInit);
1846 onDirtyBinding->bind(resource);
1847
1848 invalidateCompletenessCache();
1849}
1850
1851void Framebuffer::resetAttachment(const Context *context, GLenum binding)
1852{
1853 setAttachment(context, GL_NONE, binding, ImageIndex(), nullptr);
1854}
1855
1856angle::Result Framebuffer::syncState(const Context *context,
1857 GLenum framebufferBinding,
1858 Command command) const
1859{
1860 if (mDirtyBits.any())
1861 {
1862 mDirtyBitsGuard = mDirtyBits;
1863 ANGLE_TRY(mImpl->syncState(context, framebufferBinding, mDirtyBits, command));
1864 mDirtyBits.reset();
1865 mDirtyBitsGuard.reset();
1866 }
1867 return angle::Result::Continue;
1868}
1869
1870void Framebuffer::onSubjectStateChange(angle::SubjectIndex index, angle::SubjectMessage message)
1871{
1872 if (message != angle::SubjectMessage::SubjectChanged)
1873 {
1874 // This can be triggered by SubImage calls for Textures.
1875 if (message == angle::SubjectMessage::ContentsChanged)
1876 {
1877 mDirtyBits.set(DIRTY_BIT_COLOR_BUFFER_CONTENTS_0 + index);
1878 onStateChange(angle::SubjectMessage::DirtyBitsFlagged);
1879 return;
1880 }
1881
1882 ASSERT(message != angle::SubjectMessage::BindingChanged);
1883
1884 // This can be triggered by external changes to the default framebuffer.
1885 if (message == angle::SubjectMessage::SurfaceChanged)
1886 {
1887 onStateChange(angle::SubjectMessage::SurfaceChanged);
1888 return;
1889 }
1890
1891 // This can be triggered by the GL back-end TextureGL class.
1892 ASSERT(message == angle::SubjectMessage::DirtyBitsFlagged);
1893 return;
1894 }
1895
1896 ASSERT(!mDirtyBitsGuard.valid() || mDirtyBitsGuard.value().test(index));
1897 mDirtyBits.set(index);
1898
1899 invalidateCompletenessCache();
1900
1901 FramebufferAttachment *attachment = getAttachmentFromSubjectIndex(index);
1902
1903 // Mark the appropriate init flag.
1904 mState.mResourceNeedsInit.set(index, attachment->initState() == InitState::MayNeedInit);
1905
1906 // Update mFloat32ColorAttachmentBits Cache
1907 if (index < DIRTY_BIT_COLOR_ATTACHMENT_MAX)
1908 {
1909 ASSERT(index != DIRTY_BIT_DEPTH_ATTACHMENT);
1910 ASSERT(index != DIRTY_BIT_STENCIL_ATTACHMENT);
1911 updateFloat32ColorAttachmentBits(index - DIRTY_BIT_COLOR_ATTACHMENT_0,
1912 attachment->getFormat().info);
1913 }
1914}
1915
1916FramebufferAttachment *Framebuffer::getAttachmentFromSubjectIndex(angle::SubjectIndex index)
1917{
1918 switch (index)
1919 {
1920 case DIRTY_BIT_DEPTH_ATTACHMENT:
1921 return &mState.mDepthAttachment;
1922 case DIRTY_BIT_STENCIL_ATTACHMENT:
1923 return &mState.mStencilAttachment;
1924 default:
1925 size_t colorIndex = (index - DIRTY_BIT_COLOR_ATTACHMENT_0);
1926 ASSERT(colorIndex < mState.mColorAttachments.size());
1927 return &mState.mColorAttachments[colorIndex];
1928 }
1929}
1930
1931bool Framebuffer::formsRenderingFeedbackLoopWith(const Context *context) const
1932{
1933 const State &glState = context->getState();
1934 const ProgramExecutable *executable = glState.getProgramExecutable();
1935
1936 // In some error cases there may be no bound program or executable.
1937 if (!executable)
1938 return false;
1939
1940 const ActiveTextureMask &activeTextures = executable->getActiveSamplersMask();
1941 const ActiveTextureTypeArray &textureTypes = executable->getActiveSamplerTypes();
1942
1943 for (size_t textureIndex : activeTextures)
1944 {
1945 unsigned int uintIndex = static_cast<unsigned int>(textureIndex);
1946 Texture *texture = glState.getSamplerTexture(uintIndex, textureTypes[textureIndex]);
1947 const Sampler *sampler = glState.getSampler(uintIndex);
1948 if (texture && texture->isSamplerComplete(context, sampler) &&
1949 texture->isBoundToFramebuffer(mState.mFramebufferSerial))
1950 {
1951 // Check for level overlap.
1952 for (const FramebufferAttachment &attachment : mState.mColorAttachments)
1953 {
1954 if (AttachmentOverlapsWithTexture(attachment, texture, sampler))
1955 {
1956 return true;
1957 }
1958 }
1959
1960 if (AttachmentOverlapsWithTexture(mState.mDepthAttachment, texture, sampler))
1961 {
1962 return true;
1963 }
1964
1965 if (AttachmentOverlapsWithTexture(mState.mStencilAttachment, texture, sampler))
1966 {
1967 return true;
1968 }
1969 }
1970 }
1971
1972 return false;
1973}
1974
1975bool Framebuffer::formsCopyingFeedbackLoopWith(TextureID copyTextureID,
1976 GLint copyTextureLevel,
1977 GLint copyTextureLayer) const
1978{
1979 if (mState.isDefault())
1980 {
1981 // It seems impossible to form a texture copying feedback loop with the default FBO.
1982 return false;
1983 }
1984
1985 const FramebufferAttachment *readAttachment = getReadColorAttachment();
1986 ASSERT(readAttachment);
1987
1988 if (readAttachment->isTextureWithId(copyTextureID))
1989 {
1990 const auto &imageIndex = readAttachment->getTextureImageIndex();
1991 if (imageIndex.getLevelIndex() == copyTextureLevel)
1992 {
1993 // Check 3D/Array texture layers.
1994 return !imageIndex.hasLayer() || copyTextureLayer == ImageIndex::kEntireLevel ||
1995 imageIndex.getLayerIndex() == copyTextureLayer;
1996 }
1997 }
1998 return false;
1999}

2080
2081angle::Result Framebuffer::ensureClearAttachmentsInitialized(const Context *context,
2082 GLbitfield mask)
2083{
2084 const auto &glState = context->getState();
2085 if (!context->isRobustResourceInitEnabled() || glState.isRasterizerDiscardEnabled())
2086 {
2087 return angle::Result::Continue;
2088 }
2089
2090 const DepthStencilState &depthStencil = glState.getDepthStencilState();
2091
2092 bool color = (mask & GL_COLOR_BUFFER_BIT) != 0 && !glState.allActiveDrawBufferChannelsMasked();
2093 bool depth = (mask & GL_DEPTH_BUFFER_BIT) != 0 && !depthStencil.isDepthMaskedOut();
2094 bool stencil = (mask & GL_STENCIL_BUFFER_BIT) != 0 && !depthStencil.isStencilMaskedOut();
2095
2096 if (!color && !depth && !stencil)
2097 {
2098 return angle::Result::Continue;
2099 }
2100
2101 if (partialClearNeedsInit(context, color, depth, stencil))
2102 {
2103 ANGLE_TRY(ensureDrawAttachmentsInitialized(context));
2104 }
2105
2106 // If the impl encounters an error during a a full (non-partial) clear, the attachments will
2107 // still be marked initialized. This simplifies design, allowing this method to be called before
2108 // the clear.
2109 markDrawAttachmentsInitialized(color, depth, stencil);
2110
2111 return angle::Result::Continue;
2112}
2113
2114angle::Result Framebuffer::ensureClearBufferAttachmentsInitialized(const Context *context,
2115 GLenum buffer,
2116 GLint drawbuffer)
2117{
2118 if (!context->isRobustResourceInitEnabled() ||
2119 context->getState().isRasterizerDiscardEnabled() ||
2120 context->isClearBufferMaskedOut(buffer, drawbuffer))
2121 {
2122 return angle::Result::Continue;
2123 }
2124
2125 if (partialBufferClearNeedsInit(context, buffer))
2126 {
2127 ANGLE_TRY(ensureBufferInitialized(context, buffer, drawbuffer));
2128 }
2129
2130 // If the impl encounters an error during a a full (non-partial) clear, the attachments will
2131 // still be marked initialized. This simplifies design, allowing this method to be called before
2132 // the clear.
2133 markBufferInitialized(buffer, drawbuffer);
2134
2135 return angle::Result::Continue;
2136}
2137
2138angle::Result Framebuffer::ensureDrawAttachmentsInitialized(const Context *context)
2139{
2140 if (!context->isRobustResourceInitEnabled())
2141 {
2142 return angle::Result::Continue;
2143 }
2144
2145 // Note: we don't actually filter by the draw attachment enum. Just init everything.
2146 for (size_t bit : mState.mResourceNeedsInit)
2147 {
2148 switch (bit)
2149 {
2150 case DIRTY_BIT_DEPTH_ATTACHMENT:
2151 ANGLE_TRY(InitAttachment(context, &mState.mDepthAttachment));
2152 break;
2153 case DIRTY_BIT_STENCIL_ATTACHMENT:
2154 ANGLE_TRY(InitAttachment(context, &mState.mStencilAttachment));
2155 break;
2156 default:
2157 ANGLE_TRY(InitAttachment(context, &mState.mColorAttachments[bit]));
2158 break;
2159 }
2160 }
2161
2162 mState.mResourceNeedsInit.reset();
2163 return angle::Result::Continue;
2164}
2165
2166angle::Result Framebuffer::ensureReadAttachmentsInitialized(const Context *context)
2167{
2168 ASSERT(context->isRobustResourceInitEnabled());
2169
2170 if (mState.mResourceNeedsInit.none())
2171 {
2172 return angle::Result::Continue;
2173 }
2174
2175 if (mState.mReadBufferState != GL_NONE)
2176 {
2177 if (isDefault())
2178 {
2179 if (!mState.mDefaultFramebufferReadAttachmentInitialized)
2180 {
2181 ANGLE_TRY(InitAttachment(context, &mState.mDefaultFramebufferReadAttachment));
2182 mState.mDefaultFramebufferReadAttachmentInitialized = true;
2183 }
2184 }
2185 else
2186 {
2187 size_t readIndex = mState.getReadIndex();
2188 if (mState.mResourceNeedsInit[readIndex])
2189 {
2190 ANGLE_TRY(InitAttachment(context, &mState.mColorAttachments[readIndex]));
2191 mState.mResourceNeedsInit.reset(readIndex);
2192 }
2193 }
2194 }
2195
2196 // Conservatively init depth since it can be read by BlitFramebuffer.
2197 if (hasDepth())
2198 {
2199 if (mState.mResourceNeedsInit[DIRTY_BIT_DEPTH_ATTACHMENT])
2200 {
2201 ANGLE_TRY(InitAttachment(context, &mState.mDepthAttachment));
2202 mState.mResourceNeedsInit.reset(DIRTY_BIT_DEPTH_ATTACHMENT);
2203 }
2204 }
2205
2206 // Conservatively init stencil since it can be read by BlitFramebuffer.
2207 if (hasStencil())
2208 {
2209 if (mState.mResourceNeedsInit[DIRTY_BIT_STENCIL_ATTACHMENT])
2210 {
2211 ANGLE_TRY(InitAttachment(context, &mState.mStencilAttachment));
2212 mState.mResourceNeedsInit.reset(DIRTY_BIT_STENCIL_ATTACHMENT);
2213 }
2214 }
2215
2216 return angle::Result::Continue;
2217}
2218
2219void Framebuffer::markDrawAttachmentsInitialized(bool color, bool depth, bool stencil)
2220{
2221 // Mark attachments as initialized.
2222 if (color)
2223 {
2224 for (auto colorIndex : mState.mEnabledDrawBuffers)
2225 {
2226 auto &colorAttachment = mState.mColorAttachments[colorIndex];
2227 ASSERT(colorAttachment.isAttached());
2228 colorAttachment.setInitState(InitState::Initialized);
2229 mState.mResourceNeedsInit.reset(colorIndex);
2230 }
2231 }
2232
2233 if (depth && mState.mDepthAttachment.isAttached())
2234 {
2235 mState.mDepthAttachment.setInitState(InitState::Initialized);
2236 mState.mResourceNeedsInit.reset(DIRTY_BIT_DEPTH_ATTACHMENT);
2237 }
2238
2239 if (stencil && mState.mStencilAttachment.isAttached())
2240 {
2241 mState.mStencilAttachment.setInitState(InitState::Initialized);
2242 mState.mResourceNeedsInit.reset(DIRTY_BIT_STENCIL_ATTACHMENT);
2243 }
2244}
2245
2246void Framebuffer::markBufferInitialized(GLenum bufferType, GLint bufferIndex)
2247{
2248 switch (bufferType)
2249 {
2250 case GL_COLOR:
2251 {
2252 ASSERT(bufferIndex < static_cast<GLint>(mState.mColorAttachments.size()));
2253 if (mState.mColorAttachments[bufferIndex].isAttached())
2254 {
2255 mState.mColorAttachments[bufferIndex].setInitState(InitState::Initialized);
2256 mState.mResourceNeedsInit.reset(bufferIndex);
2257 }
2258 break;
2259 }
2260 case GL_DEPTH:
2261 {
2262 if (mState.mDepthAttachment.isAttached())
2263 {
2264 mState.mDepthAttachment.setInitState(InitState::Initialized);
2265 mState.mResourceNeedsInit.reset(DIRTY_BIT_DEPTH_ATTACHMENT);
2266 }
2267 break;
2268 }
2269 case GL_STENCIL:
2270 {
2271 if (mState.mStencilAttachment.isAttached())
2272 {
2273 mState.mStencilAttachment.setInitState(InitState::Initialized);
2274 mState.mResourceNeedsInit.reset(DIRTY_BIT_STENCIL_ATTACHMENT);
2275 }
2276 break;
2277 }
2278 case GL_DEPTH_STENCIL:
2279 {
2280 if (mState.mDepthAttachment.isAttached())
2281 {
2282 mState.mDepthAttachment.setInitState(InitState::Initialized);
2283 mState.mResourceNeedsInit.reset(DIRTY_BIT_DEPTH_ATTACHMENT);
2284 }
2285 if (mState.mStencilAttachment.isAttached())
2286 {
2287 mState.mStencilAttachment.setInitState(InitState::Initialized);
2288 mState.mResourceNeedsInit.reset(DIRTY_BIT_STENCIL_ATTACHMENT);
2289 }
2290 break;
2291 }
2292 default:
2293 UNREACHABLE();
2294 break;
2295 }
2296}
2297
2298Box Framebuffer::getDimensions() const
2299{
2300 return mState.getDimensions();
2301}
2302
2303Extents Framebuffer::getExtents() const
2304{
2305 return mState.getExtents();
2306}
2307
2308angle::Result Framebuffer::ensureBufferInitialized(const Context *context,
2309 GLenum bufferType,
2310 GLint bufferIndex)
2311{
2312 ASSERT(context->isRobustResourceInitEnabled());
2313
2314 if (mState.mResourceNeedsInit.none())
2315 {
2316 return angle::Result::Continue;
2317 }
2318
2319 switch (bufferType)
2320 {
2321 case GL_COLOR:
2322 {
2323 ASSERT(bufferIndex < static_cast<GLint>(mState.mColorAttachments.size()));
2324 if (mState.mResourceNeedsInit[bufferIndex])
2325 {
2326 ANGLE_TRY(InitAttachment(context, &mState.mColorAttachments[bufferIndex]));
2327 mState.mResourceNeedsInit.reset(bufferIndex);
2328 }
2329 break;
2330 }
2331 case GL_DEPTH:
2332 {
2333 if (mState.mResourceNeedsInit[DIRTY_BIT_DEPTH_ATTACHMENT])
2334 {
2335 ANGLE_TRY(InitAttachment(context, &mState.mDepthAttachment));
2336 mState.mResourceNeedsInit.reset(DIRTY_BIT_DEPTH_ATTACHMENT);
2337 }
2338 break;
2339 }
2340 case GL_STENCIL:
2341 {
2342 if (mState.mResourceNeedsInit[DIRTY_BIT_STENCIL_ATTACHMENT])
2343 {
2344 ANGLE_TRY(InitAttachment(context, &mState.mStencilAttachment));
2345 mState.mResourceNeedsInit.reset(DIRTY_BIT_STENCIL_ATTACHMENT);
2346 }
2347 break;
2348 }
2349 case GL_DEPTH_STENCIL:
2350 {
2351 if (mState.mResourceNeedsInit[DIRTY_BIT_DEPTH_ATTACHMENT])
2352 {
2353 ANGLE_TRY(InitAttachment(context, &mState.mDepthAttachment));
2354 mState.mResourceNeedsInit.reset(DIRTY_BIT_DEPTH_ATTACHMENT);
2355 }
2356 if (mState.mResourceNeedsInit[DIRTY_BIT_STENCIL_ATTACHMENT])
2357 {
2358 ANGLE_TRY(InitAttachment(context, &mState.mStencilAttachment));
2359 mState.mResourceNeedsInit.reset(DIRTY_BIT_STENCIL_ATTACHMENT);
2360 }
2361 break;
2362 }
2363 default:
2364 UNREACHABLE();
2365 break;
2366 }
2367
2368 return angle::Result::Continue;
2369}
2370
2371bool Framebuffer::partialBufferClearNeedsInit(const Context *context, GLenum bufferType)
2372{
2373 if (!context->isRobustResourceInitEnabled() || mState.mResourceNeedsInit.none())
2374 {
2375 return false;
2376 }
2377
2378 switch (bufferType)
2379 {
2380 case GL_COLOR:
2381 return partialClearNeedsInit(context, true, false, false);
2382 case GL_DEPTH:
2383 return partialClearNeedsInit(context, false, true, false);
2384 case GL_STENCIL:
2385 return partialClearNeedsInit(context, false, false, true);
2386 case GL_DEPTH_STENCIL:
2387 return partialClearNeedsInit(context, false, true, true);
2388 default:
2389 UNREACHABLE();
2390 return false;
2391 }
2392}
2393} // namespace gl
